# Agreement on technological projects with Military Institute of Engineering Technology-- AGH UST

Agreement on technological projects with Military Institute of Engineering Technology 

 18-02-2025 

 defence 
 cooperation 

 On 17 January 2025, the AGH University and the Military Institute of Engineering Technology (WITI) concluded a cooperation agreement. Joint actions of the institutions will contribute to the development of modern defence solutions, supporting the military and civilian sectors. 

The agreement aims to intensify research and development activities in the field of modern military techniques and technologies, civil protection, and innovative engineering solutions. 

Main objectives of the cooperation include:

joint activities to increase Poland’s defence capabilities,

development of scientific and research cooperation in selected operational domains for the Polish Army,

strengthening the potential for entrepreneurship and innovation,

implementation of joint projects in the fields of military, educational, scientific, and entrepreneurial activities.

The first joint projects concern: water purification systems adapted to extreme battlefield conditions; mobile container field hospitals equipped with antimicrobial products; and modern coatings that combat pathogens in extreme field conditions.

Future plans also include projects in the field of battlefield engineering and civil protection technology in case of an attack.

The Faculty of Non-Ferrous Metals will be responsible for the implementation of the agreement on behalf of the AGH University.

WITI carries out activities in the field of natural sciences and technology in the following areas:

diagnostics and clearance of dangerous materials,

combat agents, mainly for explosives engineering,

equipment and resources for the construction, detection, clearing and disposal of minefields,

equipment for detecting and neutralising improvised explosive devices (IEDs),

explosives,

area protection systems,

field electricity – sources of power, energy, and light,

impact of environmental and atmospheric conditions,

resistance to the effects of explosions and mechanical exposure,

recording and analysing physical phenomena, including electrical, magnetic, and gravitational influences,

engineering machinery and equipment for road works, fortification and airport maintenance,

bridge and military landing equipment,

field fortification,

equipment and resources for observation and reconnaissance, camouflage and deception,

technology and equipment for collecting, storing, processing and transmitting data during engineering reconnaissance.
